page.title: 09FIRE BRIGADE IN CALLANDER
page.content: This Brigade serves several other small towns and villages and may be called out to any part of Central Region. There are 10 men and 1 engine.The men are from many occupations and they volunteer for this service.They have basic training at Stirling station and weekly training in the town. There are an average{80 fires}a year. They are mostly forest and house fires.They are also called out to { {road accidents},for which they have a special support unit. The men meet every Thursday for training and to maintain the engine and other equipment. When a fire call comes,the engine leaves the station when the first 6 men arrive.All men carry bleepers to call them to a fire.
